intro: Zigadenus washakie, commonly known as the Washakie death cabal, is a toxic member of the buttercup family native to the western United States. It produces small, yellow flowers and has dark green, lance-shaped leaves. The plant contains toxic alkaloids, making it dangerous to both humans and animals. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in sagebrush habitats. Due to its toxicity, it is important to avoid contact with this plant.
